intro: Cionosicys guabubu, commonly known as the Guabubu tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
